channel.title: Help with server publishing
channel.description:
I am completly sure that i did everything right.
when i use a client made by some1 else, and i have a source running, then i can log into it. I can make my self mod. admin. owner and what not so i know its my server. When i push the log in button, it says its logging in to 127.0.0.1, which is the local server i think.
How do i make it so other people can play on my server. i already did all that portforwarding stuff. Please help
Do i need to hard code my ip into the client.java file, release that, then maybe some1 will be able to get on?
~delicious

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @delicious delicious
item.description:
@delicious wrote:

ok, well i can get on, but i tried to insert my ip into the client, but its not really working any suggestions? and i do have a no-ip. and no-ip duc

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @xjadefighter xjadefighter
item.description:
@xjadefighter wrote:

Umm try going on no-ip.org make a account then make a host there that will be ur server ip after that download the client thing there so u can check ur ip any time then when ur done just put ur ip in on the client ur useing and it should let u in and other pplhope this helps =\

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @Project_Territh Project Territh
item.description:
@Project_Territh wrote:

It could be your client you are using, or it just could be the ip you made or something along those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @delicious delicious
item.description:
@delicious wrote:

yea b boyz thats what i was going for thanks!

and i know i am the only one that can get on local host that connects to my server. thanks!

and i need to put my ip into the client right like you said

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

woops. Lol I read his wrong. Well if you want people to get on using your ip with the client your using. Do what I told you. Then upload it to uppit or somethin. Then post on server status, and tell them to dl client

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @Mazeingmaze Mazeingmaze
item.description:
@Mazeingmaze wrote:

No you don’t, once you’ve port forwarded click run.bat. Now, only you can connect to local host (127.0.0.1), everyone else can connect via your IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server publishing
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

in your client look for a file called EGUI go in there and you should see something like:

"", "", "", or "127.0.0.1", "127.0.0.1", "127.0.0.1"

If it is the first one just add you ip between the “”. And if it is the second one just delete the 127.0.0.1 and change it to your ip.

Read full topic
